Title: Tinubu returns as Fubara set for reinstatement, LP seeks emergency rule probe
Summary: Tinubu returns as Rivers State Governor Siminalayi Fubara is set for reinstatement . Rivers State governor is due back in office tomorrow following the expiration of his term . Tinuba returned to Abuja from his working vacation abroad .

Title: Insider threats, low confidence hobble $14b aviation target
Summary: Federal Government's ambitious plan to grow the local air transport market from $2.5 billion to $14.1 billion in Gross Domestic Product (GDP) contribution yearly may be met with revenue decline and investors . Insider threats, low confidence hobble $14b aviation target .

Title: Atiku meets U.S. envoy in Abuja, flays tribalism in Nigeria
Summary: Former Vice President of Nigeria, Atiku Abubakar, led a delegation on a courtesy visit to the United States Ambassador, Richard Mills Jr., in Abuja .

Title: FG: Nigeria needs $100b yearly investments to hit middle-income status
Summary: Federal Government has stated that Nigeria must attract at least $100 billion in investments yearly to become a middle-income country by 2050 . Minister of Budget and National Planning, Atiku Bagudu, stated this yesterday .

Title: PDP throws 2027 presidential ticket open to all regions
Summary: PDP throws 2027 presidential ticket open to all aspirants . Decision described as vindication of position long canvassed by Dr Gbenga Olawepo-Hashim . PDP still retains principle of zoning to the South .

Title: MAN commends FG for suspending 4% FOB levy by Customs
Summary: Manufacturers Association of Nigeria commends FG for suspending 4% FOB levy by Customs . The move comes as a result of a suspension by the Nigeria Customs Service . Director General of MAN, Segun Ajayi-Kadir, said the move was a good move .

Title: Lokpobiri seeks regional energy integration to tackle $120bn import bill
Summary: Sen. Heineken Lokpobiri has called for a deeper regional integration to tackle the $120 billion energy import bill faced by African countries annually . He made the call at Africa Oil Week (AOW) 2025 Ministerial and CEO Leadership Forum in Accra, Ghana .

Title: CBN committed to financial inclusiveness, stimulate productivity — Cardoso
Summary: Central Bank of Nigeria committed to financial inclusiveness and stimulate productivity . CBN Governor, Olayemi Cardoso made this known during a fair it organized in Kano .

Title: Tinubu has stabilised Buhari’s poorly managed economy  —  SDP’s Adebayo
Summary: Adebayo argued that while Tinubu has made progress in certain sectors, he has yet to diagnose Nigeria’s fundamental economic problems .
